raw_text:
Snow Patrol feted at Irish awards
 
 Snow Patrol were the big winners in Ireland's top music honours, the Meteor Awards, picking up accolades for best Irish band and album on Thursday.
 
 The Belfast-born, Glasgow-based band collected the prizes at the ceremony at Dublin's Point Theatre. Westlife won the award for best Irish pop act, voted for by the public, beating former member Brian McFadden. Franz Ferdinand picked up best international band and album while Paddy Casey collected best Irish male. Singer-songwriter Casey beat Brian McFadden and Damien Rice. Juliette Turner was named best Irish female.
 
 In the international categories, Morrissey beat Eminem, Usher and Robbie Williams to best male while PJ Harvey pipped Kylie Minogue, Joss Stone, Anastacia and Natasha Bedingfield to the female crown. The 8,000 fans at the ceremony were treated to performances from US rapper Snoop Dogg, Brian McFadden with Delta Goodrem and The Thrills featuring Rolling Stones star Ronnie Wood. Snow Patrol's success came after a year in which they made a chart breakthrough with their third album Final Straw. "I think a lot of bands should go through a wee bit of a kicking before the make a success," singer Gary Lightbody and drummer Jonny Quinn said. "It has been good for us, but also hard for us over the past six years." Snow Patrol will support U2 on their European tour later this year - but U2 were not nominated for best Irish band and album.
llama3.2:1b: Snow Patrol won Meteor Awards in Ireland for Best Irish Band and Album.
The Belfast-based band was awarded prizes at a ceremony at Dublin's Point Theatre.

* Snow Patrol won the following awards:
  + Best Irish Band
  + Album: Final Straw

* Westlife (voted by the public) won Best Irish Pop Act.

* Franz Ferdinand won Best International Band & Album
* Paddy Casey won Best Irish Male
* Juliette Turner was named Best Irish Female

* Morrissey beat Eminem, Usher and Robbie Williams in the international category for Best Male Artist.
* PJ Harvey pipped Kylie Minogue, Joss Stone, Anastacia and Natasha Bedingfield to win Best Female Artist.
The ceremony featured performances by US rapper Snoop Dogg, Brian McFadden with Delta Goodrem and The Thrills featuring Ronnie Wood.
llama3.2:3b: Snow Patrol won top honors at Ireland's Meteor Awards, taking home awards for best Irish band and album, beating out other notable acts including Westlife and Franz Ferdinand.
Morrissey took the award for best male singer, while PJ Harvey was named best female.

The ceremony also featured performances from Snoop Dogg, Brian McFadden, and Ronnie Wood, with Snow Patrol citing their chart breakthrough on their third album Final Straw as a key factor in their success.

opencoder:1.5b:
The following key ideas are present in the provided text:

1.
Snow Patrol was a group of Irish top singers who won multiple awards, including the Meteor Awards.
The group collected the prizes at the ceremony.
Westlife was one of the winners and won the best Irish pop act award.
Fans from around the world experienced performances with Snoop Dogg, Brian McFadden and Delta Goodrem on U2's album Final Straw.
Snow Patrol's success came after a year when they made their album chart a breakthrough with third place in the North American Top 2000 Billboard Hot 100.
As for the European tour, U2 were not selected for the best Irish band and album award.
The group also won the best male and female single in 2019.
smollm:1.7b: Snow Patrol feted at Irish awards
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Snow Patrol won best Irish band and best international band awards at the 2023 Meteor Awards, with Juliette Turner becoming the best female singer-songwriter and Casey taking first place for best male.
Westlife won best Irish pop act, while Morrissey took best male and PJ Harvey secured best female.
Snow Patrol will support U2 on their European tour, though U2 wasn't nominated for best Irish awards.
The ceremony was held at Dublin's Point Theatre in Ireland.
tinyllama:1.1b: Snow Patrol fue bien recibido en la cumbre de las mejores grabaciones y estatuas en los Ireland Awards, que se celebraron el viernes en Dublín.

El grupo irlandés, que actúa ahora como unigrupo, entró por primera vez a los récords con su tercer álbum Final Straight, ganando tres premios: mejor banda y álbum de rock en español o estatal (por encuadrarse entre bandas de rock internacionales) y más importante de la temporada; mejor artista irlandés internacional (por ser el primero desde Oasis que consigue una candidatura); e internacional mejor artista irlandés (con Oasis).

Además, se llevó a cabo una ceremonia en los Point Theatre donde obtuvo otras tres estatuas: mejor álbum de rock/pop (para su segundo álbum, The Reseal) y más importante del año; mejor artista irlandés masculino (por ser el primer desde Boyzone que consigue una candidatura); e internacional mejor artista irlandés femenino (con Kylie Minogue).
El festival de música estadounidense, The Sound of Music, también se presentó en la ceremonia.

Los otros premios se otorgaron a la canción "Walking on Your Grave" de Snow Patrol, que ganó el premio del público, a "Lie To Me" de Morrissey, segundo mejor canción y a "I Will Follow You Into the Darkness" de PJ Harvey (segundo mejor canción) y a "Friday I'm in Love" de The Thrills, tercer mejor canción.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Snow Patrol were feted at Ireland's top music awards, the Meteor Awards, where they won best Irish band and album.
In addition to these prestigious accolades, they also picked up best Irish pop act voted by the public, beating former members Brian McFadden and Franz Ferdinand.
Irish singer-songwriter Casey won best Irish male and was named best Irish female, with Juliette Turner winning best Irish female.
The international categories saw Morrissey outperform Eminem, Usher, Robbie Williams and Kylie Minogue.

However, Snoop Dogg's performance at the ceremony did not go down well with some fans who felt it was too commercial, while The Thrills featuring Rolling Stones star Ronnie Wood were applauded for their energetic performance.

In international categories, Morrissey beat Eminem, Usher, and Robbie Williams to best male while PJ Harvey won best female.
The Meteor Awards are Ireland's top music honours and Snow Patrol made a chart breakthrough with their album Final Straw in 2007.
